model_solution:
Step 1:  Add corresponding components of the two vectors together.
$\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 4 \\ -6 \end{pmatrix} + \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -1 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 1+2 \\ 4-1 \\ -6+3 \end{pmatrix}$
Step 2: $\begin{pmatrix} 1+2 \\ 4-1 \\ -6+3 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 3 \\ -3 \end{pmatrix}$
Step 3: The result is $\begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 3 \\ -3 \end{pmatrix}$.
Step 4: The result is $\begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 3 \\ -3 \end{pmatrix}$.

Final Answer.

full_steps:
Step 1:  Add corresponding components of the two vectors together.
$\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 4 \\ -6 \end{pmatrix} + \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -1 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 1+2 \\ 4-1 \\ -6+3 \end{pmatrix}$

Step 4: The result is $\begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 3 \\ -3 \end{pmatrix}$.

Final Answer.
